name: tagalong
content:
tagalong noun [C]
(BICYCLE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a children's bicycle designed to attach to the back of an adult's bicycle: I bike the kids to school. My son sits in the trailer and my daughter goes on the tagalong. Careless drivers doing 60mph veered too close to my children's tagalong.
More examplesFewer examplesHe looked over his shoulder at the tagalong and shouted, "You OK, Max?" My husband can connect the tagalong and trailer to his bike to get the kids home.

tagalong noun [C]
(EXTRA PERSON)
someone who goes somewhere or does something with another person or other people, especially when they has not been invited: I was only meant to be a tagalong when my wife and her friends went skiing. He would portray the teen as a tagalong, talked into the burglary with no idea someone would be hurt.
More examplesFewer examplesKatie is the tagalong who refuses to be ignored or excluded.They spend their summer with new dorky tagalong, Ken.Unimpressed by the prospect of a teenage tagalong, the cyclists promply leave him behind at mile 2.
